## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 297, 301, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Theory (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 366, 374]]<|/det|>
No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 359, 530]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 767, 560]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 604, 585]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 757, 600]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 520, 89]]<|/det|>
A train of mass \(5.6 \times 10^{5} \text{kg}\) is at rest in a station.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 806, 120]]<|/det|>
At time \(t = 0 \text{s}\), a resultant force acts on the train and it starts to accelerate forwards.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 645, 151]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 is the distance-time graph for the train for the first 120 s.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 163, 833, 551]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[487, 562, 556, 581]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 594, 144, 613]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 594, 180, 613]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 594, 411, 613]]<|/det|>
Use Fig. 1.1 to determine:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 625, 603, 644]]<|/det|>
1. the average speed of the train during the 120 s

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 712, 920, 730]]<|/det|>
<form>average speed = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 743, 537, 762]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[512, 829, 920, 848]]<|/det|>
<form>speed = ............................................................ [2]

<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 510, 181]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 640, 181, 658]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 640, 920, 673]]<|/det|>
The mass of the ball is \(4.0\mathrm{kg}\). The girl exerts a force on the ball for \(0.60\mathrm{s}\). The speed of the ball increases from \(0\mathrm{m / s}\) to \(12\mathrm{m / s}\) before it leaves the girl's hand.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 685, 281, 702]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 714, 643, 732]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 817, 606, 835]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 890, 920, 907]]<|/det|>
